title: Gonzaga vs UCLA live stream: how to watch March Madness 2021 from anywhere
author: aatif-sulleyman
summary: The favorites take on one of the all-time great underdogs
article: The Bruins have defied all odds to get here, but now they need a Space Jam moment. Facing them in the March Madness National Semifinals are the all-conquering Bulldogs, undefeated all season, on a 34-game winning streak and set go down as one of the all-time great college basketball teams. It's the No. 1 seed vs the No. 44 seed, so read on as we explain how to get a Gonzaga vs UCLA live stream and watch March Madness from anywhere in the world - don't miss a single moment of the NCAA basketball tournament.

The Zags have beaten their March Madness opponents by a combined margin of 96 points, trashing USC in the Elite Eight to bring their run of consecutive double-digit victories to 27. In Drew Timme, Jalen Suggs, Corey Kispert and Joel Ayayi they have a formidable core four of the tournament's brightest talents.

The Bruins, meanwhile, are only the second team to make it from the First Four to the Final Four, with Johnny Juzang their main man, averaging 21.25 points per game, with a 48.5% shooting percentage. They're one of the country's top offensive teams and have a very strong defense too, but... these are the Zags.

Follow our guide below to tune into a March Madness live stream and watch Gonzaga vs UCLA online from anywhere - including some great ways to watch March Madness free online in certain countries, if you draw up the right play.

If you're currently abroad or there's no official broadcast option in your country, then you’ll need to use a VPN to dial in to a location that does let you watch March Madness online in the same way you would at home.

A VPN is perfect for this, as it allows you to change your IP address so you appear to be in your country of residence, where you usual streaming services and subscriptions are based. You may be surprised by how easy it easy to get started using one, too.

In some countries, you may be baffled by the fact that NCAA college basketball is just as popular as the NBA among some fans. If you want to know what all the fuss is about or are just a US expat living abroad that's desperate to root for their school, then ESPN Player is the way to watch a March Madness live stream in many countries around the world.
It's available in the UK, Europe, the Middle East and Africa, coming in at the very reasonable price of £9.99/€11.99 for the next month (or £69.99/€79.99 for a whole year).

That gets you live and on-demand coverage of every single March Madness 2021 game, as well as access to other live sports events, ESPN originals and ESPN Films. The service also supports both desktop and mobile, so you’ll never miss any of the action, no matter where you.

Best of all, anyone in one of the service's covered countries can try a FREE 7-day ESPN Player trial to see if they like it or not - one of the few legitimate ways to watch NCAA March Madness free online.
